Reviews.Title: “Very reasonable budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: JustineLow
Reviews.Content: We have been staying in this hotel for twice and once we were sent to the other joint hotel just beside them due to overbooking. Everytime we visit Madrid, we'll go back there because although the room is simple but clean and comfortable, big enough for 3 of us. Beside that, the other advantage is the metro station just round the corner so making it very convenience to move about Madrid. There's no problem to park our car along the street and take the metro to explore the city. Highly recommended for those looking for good budget hotel for less than 40€!

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Nieuwerkerk aan den Ijssel, The Netherlands
Reviews.Title: “DIRTY TOWELS AND LACK OF GLASSES”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Normally I am not a complaining guy, but entering a hotelroom and noticing a total lack of glasses, cups or what have you - just to brush your teeth with - was reason for a first complaint. The answer - ''we never supply glasses or papercups'' - was really surprising. Eventually I got a few plastic cups (the same they use in the morning for your fruitjuice), but still it wasn't very professional. And then the towels: the first one had brown stains on it and the second one was coloured red (as in lipgloss). I told them and can only hope they find a better cleaners. Breakfast was OK. Not luxurious, but as you expect in an ETAP hotel. The hotel is situated in an industrial estate, but with one hundred meters of a subway station that brings you direct to the Opera and with one change of trains to all other touristy places in Madrid. No complains there. Staff was friendly and tried to speak English. As it was my first visit to Spain, my Spanish is non existant, but we manage.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and clean, but far”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is cheap and clean, but it is far from the city centre. However, it is very close to a metro line that goes there directly. Staff were friendly and helpful. Adjacent hotel Ibis has a luggage storage room for a 5 euro flat fee.

Reviews.Title: “Fair”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Small room for up to three people. No telephone. No room service. The surroundings correspond to an industrial area that is slowly being renewed. It's far from the center, though there is a metro station nearby (Suanzes). Worth the money if you only go to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing.”
Reviews.Author: Junky87
Reviews.Content: We entered the name of the hotel into google maps and ended up near the jail, so don't do this. Once we did manage to get to the hotel we were greeted by a young blonde girl on reception after she finished talking with another member of staff. She seemed disinterested in checking us in and took a long time. We asked for a map of the city and she threw it at us without explaining where we were (off the map ironically) or anything about the city. We asked about breakfast and she failed to tell us that this had not been included with our reservation and therefore incurred an extra cost. We also asked for the location of the nearest laundromat (it had been a long time so we were desperate) and she told us the name of a shopping centre without telling us where it was. After we asked she reluctantly wrote it down for us with the name of the metro station to get there. The laundromat was not there, either. At another time we wanted to purchase wifi (5 euro per 24 hours - the first Etap we have stayed at to charge for wifi) and she seemed more interested in batting her eyelids at a male guest she had finished checking in prior to us, rather then completing our request. All other members of staff were ok. The room was typical Etap - clean, simple and basic. Nothing more than you would expect for the price. We had breakfast one morning and it was the poorest variety we have seen at an Etap. The location is typical of Etap - within a couple of minutes walking of public transport making it very convenient to get into the city centre. Overall it is typical of an Etap - cheap, basic and close to public transport, just don't expect great customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Good position, near metro /subway/ station.”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Good position, near metro /subway/ station. Free car parking place at street, or secure hotel parking place for 7Eur / 24h. Very convient to use metro, grocery and cafeteria, restaurants close to hotel walking distance from 5 - 15 min. Hotel basic and clean.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location”
Reviews.Author: H G
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights in this hotel. The hotel is several minutes walk to Sanzes Metro station, which can bring you to down town in 20 minutes. The hotel is also close to some restaurants, groceries and shoping malls, it's about 10-20 minutes by a taxi to airport, costing about 20 euros, and hotel can ask a taxi for you. The room is small and clean with a shower and a toilet. You can watch CNN through a small LCD TV. The 39 euros per night is real worthwhile in my opinion. We didn't try the breakfast, you can easily have your breakfast in the nearby bars or restaurants, or you can buy something from the groceries. Only one problem is the terrible smell sometimes, you can opean window, it would vanish in minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money and a good night's sleep”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The title says it all. I needed somewhere to break my journey between the Costa Blanca and Santander and was satisfied with this choice. Having stayed in Etap hotels before I knew what to expect. I was aware that I was not paying a lot and have reviewed accordingly. My only qualms were the sewage type smell coming up the shower cubicle drain and the breakfast, The choice for breakfast was more limited than I've experienced before at Etap

Reviews.Title: “good value”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: convenient to metro (perhaps one long block), metro system excellent. Nice breakfast, helpful management (good english), room and bath are clean but so small that a even a small suitcase could not be rolled between the foot of the bed and the wall. The neighborhood mixed---mostly commercial. Steet narrow and conjested. Parking available. Stores, restaurants one long block.

Reviews.Title: “Staying at Etap Valentino in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: 20 minutes distance by subway till the city center, situated to 3 minutes walk from Suanzes metro station. Rooms are very tiny, pretty clean and have TV. The hotel personnel is OK, some of them speak also English. Breakfast can be purchased for 3.90 EUR / person - but it should be improved (just butter, coffee, tea, milk, cereals and jam). Good price for Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Etap Madri Very Good”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Metro Line 5 very near. The location is very silent. The Hotel is Clean. It’s not dangerous. Around the Hotel you can find a little supermarket and some restaurants. Coffee is more simple them other ETAP, (no yogurt, no cheese). I used to by my own cheese on supermarket. It’s Near Train Station and the Airport. Taxi costs 16 Euros to both. It’s very easy to go to Madrid by metro (12 stations, metro is very efficient and you can combine many lines). You may use a Tourist ticket for 3 days (13 Euros) to travel unlimited times in metro.

Reviews.Title: “just what we needed, comfy, cheap, accessible”
Reviews.Author: carlos_e_sofia
Reviews.Content: we stayed in this hotel for one night, for a stopover in Madrid. We had landed at 11pm, got to the hotel after midnight, were very well received and the receptionist indicated us where we could grab some food to eat - there is a series os restaurantes/ pubs on the main street where the metro station is, and, about 100m further, a large supermarket by Corte Inglés. Not too expensive and has ready to go food. The rooms are Etap basic, so no complains here, bed ok, pillows too. Shower pretty good, almost ibis level. the only minus are the windows. We had the corner room, which had huge windows, one of each facinf the road, and the courtain wasnt functioning - the little cord was broken - but we somehow pulled it down and it stayed down. The breakfast is also Etap like, for 3.90€, all you can eat: bread, toast, milk, orange juice, yogurt, coffee, tea, croissants. donuts, cheese, ham, butter.... Do your research when booking, spech if you're arriving by night, so you dont have to wander on those empty streets. on the way off the metro, it's the 1st street on the left (if you have the avenue on your right) - see it on google maps as we did.

Reviews.Title: “A comfortable stay.”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I thought this hotel was excellent value for the money. Okay, the rooms are pretty small & crowded with the bed, but for the solo traveler there's a bunk bed above where you can sleep, and put all your stuff on the double bed below, which makes it feel much more roomy. It's in a nice quiet semi-residential area, with a wonderful Italian restaurant, small bars & cafes right up the street, and a beautiful huge park a 5-minute walk away. Subway/bus totally convenient too. The 5 euro charge for using WiFi is a big ripoff though. If they must charge, why not make it a couple of euros then most people would be willing to pay. We all need it! The breakfast is not great, but it's okay if you need one before a flight. Cheaper than the airport. It would be nicer if we got plates for the bread/croissants instead of having to use napkins for plates!

Reviews.Title: “Loud, old, malfunctioning window.”
Reviews.Author: maggieTh_2
Reviews.Content: I have scarcely seen a firmly closing window in a southern european etap, but this was the most intersting one. The window remained 5 mm open, even with closed handle. There were not even one way beakers in the room. The guy at the reception has been shouting all the night and could be heard in ma first floor room - although there was a door separating the ground floor from the rest of the hotel, but this was kept widely open. The carpet was dirty. The using of the WiFi costs 5 Euro extra and the underground parking 7 Euro! There must be better choises even in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Above average hotel but location misnomer”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Very good standard for an etap. ISIC accepted here. The hotel is hidden from street sight. You will see Ibis from the connecting road valentin beato. If you reach ibis first just ask the front desk for directions and they"ll send you to the etap by the back.

Reviews.Title: “Good location/great value”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: hotel os located 250 m from Sunaces Metro station, come directly to Gran Via station, typical Etap Breakfast, 40 min. by metro from airport Barajas, Terminal 1. No left luggage room, so we left aour luggage on Atocha station (3€ per day small luggage). I always stay here in Madrid, never dissapointed.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap stay, clean room”
Reviews.Author: annabanannaMelbourne
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through the Etap website for 32 Euros/night (non-refundable). It was the cheapest rate we could find in Madrid! Room had a double bed, with a single bunk over it. Beds were comfortable, and rooms were clean. The only problems we had were a very smelly shower drain, and air-conditioning that only produced heat. Bear in mind that the rooms and bathrooms are quite small and cramped, as is usually the case with low-cost hotels. Rooms were cleaned daily. Very quiet at night. Wi-fi is 5 euros for a 24 hour pass. It was very fast, with unlimited downloads. We did not try breakfast (3.95 euros for croissants, toast, cereal, coffee etc) as we found that the Ibis Hotel just behind Etap had a much better breakfast for 6.50 euros). Location is ok, 100 metres to the Metro (station Suanzes), and about a 15-20 min ride into the centre of Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “near to the airport”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Value for money for a room near the airport you cant beat the value of this hotel. T o get from the airport you catch bus 200 to canijelles, then take the metro 2 stopes to Suanzes. The Eatap is 3 minutes walk from the metro. this journey costs two euros. This hotel is also good to travel to the centre of Madrid the metro line goes to the Grand Via, without the need to change lines. The rooms are clean and and adequate for a few nights, we have stayed there many times.

Reviews.Title: “Easy access, good money value, nice people.”
Reviews.Author: costindan
Reviews.Content: Good choice for a visit in Madrid! Andrei from reception is the best! Thanks one more time!

Reviews.Title: “Good deal of hotel”
Reviews.Author: PANCHOBARRONR
Reviews.Content: This is a nice deceant new hotel,,,bang for the buck,,,for 45 euros, you get a new hotel room with a double bed and a single bunk bed,perfect for a family of 4,or two or one,this hotel is great,a block from the SUANZES METRO station,,and around the corner you have a OPENCOR,this is a convinience store with liquor,beer,bakery,fruit,dvd,dely meats,the works for a nice picknic or late night snack,any way,this hotel is a good value,,the breakfast dont try it 4 euros for orange drink,coffe bread...not worth,,,,,,any way this hotel is good i will return.also the WIFI, is 5 euros for 24 hours good deal

Reviews.Title: “Good and cheap one”
Reviews.Author: SudhirOjha
Reviews.Content: This is as usual ETAP hotel with cheap rooms and good breakfast available for enjoying the stay. Its well near to madrid airport and connected also through bus. Etap hotel are always favoured among young groups as it includes breakfast in some xtra cost.

Reviews.Title: “Previous reviews over-rated this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: TreadwellLake
Reviews.Content: Previous reviews we read on this hotel set an expectation much higher than the hotel could deliver. Room was minimal in everyway, small cramped room, lack of towels (2 only, no hand towels or facecloths). The worst thing was the shower had a sewer smell and room was not very clean. Hotel is located on a small side street which was quite intimidating at night. Staff was helpful and hotel was quiet. Hotel is a 5 minute walk to Metro station, approx 12 stops to the old city and minimum of two transfers to the airport. We will not being staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, clean and good priced”
Reviews.Author: evlenol
Reviews.Content: We needed a place to sleep in Madrid, because we had a flight from Madrid Barajas Airport the next morning. We paid 45 Euros for the room, 7 Euros for car parking - and 3,90 Euros per person for breakfast. I think that the price for the room and the parking was valuable, but not the price for breakfast. The room was small, but very nice. It looked very new and shiny. There was also separate rooms for shower and toilet, so one person can shower while the other person is at the toilet. There was a little bit bad smell inside the shower room, and I believe it was because it comes very small amounts of air inside there when the door is closed - which it is most of the time. If you want to discover the city, this hotel is a good choice. It is a bit far from the city, but the metro station Suanzes is only 200 meters away. We took the metro to Gran Via, and the trip lasted for about 20 minutes. So we had a nice evening in Madrid! When we drove from the hotel to the airport the next day, that was very easy - even we didnt use our GPS. If you have time to eat breakfast in the city, I would recommend that. The breakfast costs 3,90 Euros per person, and that is not expensive - but the breakfast buffet is not very good. There was no ham, only jam, marmelade and honey to have on the bread. And the only bread they had was white bread sliced into very thick slices. They also had Frosties, Corn Flakes, orange juice and milk. That's it! So I don't think that their breakfast buffet is worth the money. But if you eat breakfast somewhere else, the hotel is an excellent budget choice!

Reviews.Title: “good location, good price”
Reviews.Author: bazbov
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 2 night stay in Madrid.The hotel although very basic was extremely clean.The staff were very friendly and the basic breakfast was good value.The location although on the outskirts of the city centre was very safe and with the metro stop just up the road and turn right was easily accesible.It cost 1 euro to get into the city and the Metro itself is very user friendly and clean.Tip: buy a book of ten metro tickets for 7 euro. All in all a very enjoyable stay at a very economical price. Madrid is a very clean city with lots of reasonably priced restaurants,especially menu del dias.We'd definately stay at the etap again

HotelInfo.Name: Etap Madrid Valentin Beato
HotelInfo.Address: Rufino Gonzalez 19 | (Metro Suanze), 28037 Madrid, Spain
